solution_line_template: The pants are ${pants_price} and are buy one get one 1/2 off so the second pair will be {pants_price}*{discount_fraction} = $<<{pants_price}*{discount_fraction}={second_pair_pants_cost}>>{second_pair_pants_cost}

The first pair of pants is ${pants_price} and the second pair is ${second_pair_pants_cost} so the pants cost {pants_price}+{second_pair_pants_cost} = $<<{pants_price}+{second_pair_pants_cost}={total_pants_cost}>>{total_pants_cost}
The skirts are ${skirt_price} each and she's buying {num_skirts} so that's {skirt_price}*{num_skirts} = $<<{skirt_price}*{num_skirts}={total_skirts_cost}>>{total_skirts_cost}
The blouses are ${blouse_price} each and she's buying {num_blouses} so that's {blouse_price}*{num_blouses} = $<<{blouse_price}*{num_blouses}={total_blouses_cost}>>{total_blouses_cost}

All total, her wardrobe will cost ${total_pants_cost} for the pants, ${total_skirts_cost} for the skirts and ${total_blouses_cost} for the blouses so {total_pants_cost}+{total_skirts_cost}+{total_blouses_cost} = $<<{total_pants_cost}+{total_skirts_cost}+{total_blouses_cost}={total_wardrobe_cost}>>{total_wardrobe_cost}
